intro: Opuntia occidentalis var. vaseyi, commonly known as the Sonoran prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to the Sonoran Desert. It is characterized by its flat, fleshy stems that are often covered in spines and glochids, which are small, barbed bristles. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its fruit, known as a tunas, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. This resilient plant is well adapted to arid environments and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
